relatedanime.anime: Sekai Meisaku Gekijou Kanketsu Ban: Ai Shoujo Pollyanna Story

recommendations.recommendation: This is the nice anime from 80` decade T_T

anime.description: * Based on the 1913 classic children`s novel Pollyanna by http://anidb.net/cr10101 [Eleanor Hodgman Porter]. http://anidb.net/ch73314 [Pollyanna] is an active and cheerful American girl. After her father dies, she moves from a little town in the Midwest to the East, where her http://anidb.net/ch73411 [aunt] lives. She is Pollyanna`s only living relative, but is a very cold and self-centered woman. Despite her adverse circumstances, Pollyanna is always positive and brings happiness to everyone around her. Source: AnimeNfo

externalentity.identifier: 愛少女ポリアンナ物語

tag.name: dynamic
tag.description: Some of the central structural elements in anime are: Plot Continuity How does the plot or several plots unfold. Are they a strictly linear retelling of one big continuing story, a serial, possibly with several side stories, or is the content chopped into a set of unconnected episodes, only sharing the same setting and characters? Stereotype Characters Then there is the question of the character set presentation. Is it completely original, or is it your usual stereotypical character cast. Both choices have their merit, for example it would not really make much sense to reinvent the wheel for a harem anime. Fans of that genre come to expect their favourite stereotype protagonists. Plot Twists Finally there is the question of how complex the plot / the story unfolds. Are there side-plots that merge into the main plot leading to unexpected plot twists, or is the anime quite predictable? The latter would not be appropriate for detective stories. In harem anime on the other hand a foreseeable outcome is actually something the fans will come to expect.

tag.name: target audience
tag.description: Anime, like everything else in the modern world, is targeted towards specific audiences, both implicitly by the creators and overtly by the marketing. While categories are associated with specific sex and age groups, this is not a bar on the anime being enjoyed by people who don`t fit into that band; not only do crossover titles exist, but the categories also have a considerable following outside their main demographic, and a person might as well enjoy anime from all categories. Still, does not invalidate the usefulness of marking a title as one of the categories; the same themes will likely be treated differently in anime geared for different audiences. Only one should not jump the gun and assume that a title will be more or less serious or present content in this or that way due to its target audience, or conversely assume the target audience on the content and its presentation alone. As such, the audience categories help form a broad impression of how a title might work with the announced themes, but offer little to no in-depth information about specific content or its treatment. The audience categories originate from manga magazines, which group titles of a same intended audience into a magazine that is advertised as belonging to that category, and so manga-based anime will have the category from their parent work. As for anime based on other works, the audience is often debatable, but comparing information such as time slot to the manga-based anime generally helps figure out the most likely possibility. If the parent material was classified under multiple audiences over time (for example, it was originally shounen, but then as the plot changed and became more mature, it was reclassified as seinen), and the anime adapts parent material time periods covering multiple audiences, we tag all audiences covered by the anime adaptation.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: setting
tag.description: The setting describes in what time and place an anime takes place. To a certain extent it describes what you can expect from the world in the anime.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: time
tag.description: This placeholder lists different epochs in human history and more vague but important timelines such as the future, the present and the past.

tag.name: place
tag.description: The places the anime can take place in. Includes more specific places such as a country on Earth, as well as more general places such as a dystopia or a mirror world.

tag.name: mina
tag.description: In the context of manga and associated media, the word mina refers to a broad audience, which can be said to be "the entire family", from the grumpy grandpa to the newborn baby. In Japanese, the word means simply "everyone", and has no anime/manga-related connotations at all. It does not comprise a style or a genre per se, but rather indicates the publisher`s intended target demographic. Mina works are deliberately targeted at a range of people as wide as possible, and are commonly associated with high-budget releases that require a very large audience to be financially viable. They usually bring mildly philosophical themes so that the adults can be interested, but do so without bringing objectionable content so that the children can be allowed to watch, and indeed also feature content specifically geared to spark their interest.

tag.name: past
tag.description: Anime that takes place in the past or clearly seems to take place in the past in case of an alternative universe. This category should almost always go together with one of its sub-categories, because the past can either be a depiction of a historical event(s) or not, in which case it would be alternative past.

tag.name: Earth
tag.description: The Earth is the third planet from the Sun, and the densest and fifth-largest of the eight planets in the Solar System. It is in effect a ball of hot mud, but on the surface it`s cold enough, so most of us live on it (or are supposed to). It is circa 4.5 billion years old, and, unless we humans succeed in destroying it over the next couple of centuries, it is expected to last for quite another while, though the changes in the Sun`s emissions due to its aging will likely cause the extinction of everything; the species of earthlings are guaranteed to die, even if we fail to kill them -- unless, of course, we find ourselves another planet and figure out a way to take everything there. Our little planet on a corner of this galaxy may mean nothing in the grand scheme of things, but to its inhabitants it is their home, so, as a species, we cherish it dearly, to the point many cultures even to this day deify it. Being the home to the human civilizations, the Earth is the main setting of most fiction, be it anime or otherwise, but not only are many titles set in other places, such as unrelated fantasy worlds, in a considerable number of fictional titles the Earth is actually destroyed by aggressive alien invaders.

tag.name: historical
tag.description: Historical anime have clear ties to our history and usually occur in a particular epoch.

tag.name: plot continuity
tag.description: Consistency of the characteristics of persons, plot, objects, places and events seen by the viewer. A single linear focused plot is highly continuous. A truly random plot is highly discontinuous.

tag.name: novel
tag.description: A novel is a relatively long work of narrative fiction, normally written in prose form, and which is typically published as a book. Manga, comics, or visual novels do not fit this description and are not considered novels; including a small number of illustrations, however, is still permissible, which means that light novels are considered novels.

tag.name: United States
tag.description: The United States of America (commonly referred to as the United States, the U.S., the USA, or America) is a federal constitutional republic comprising fifty states and a federal district. The country is situated mostly in central North America, where its forty-eight contiguous states and Washington, D.C., the capital district, lie between the Pacific and Atlantic Oceans, bordered by Canada to the north and Mexico to the south. The state of Alaska is in the north-west of the continent, with Canada to the east and Russia to the west across the Bering Strait. The state of Hawaii is an archipelago in the mid-Pacific. The country also possesses several territories in the Caribbean and Pacific. Source: wiki

tag.name: Americas
tag.description: The Americas, also collectively called America, encompass the totality of the continents of North America and South America. Together they make up most of Earth`s western hemisphere and comprise the New World. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: daily life
tag.description: The antics of the protagonists do not take place in some exotic setting or time, but in everyday life. When not "at the job" this means getting up in the morning, making meals, house cleaning, going shopping or out to eat, visiting the bath house or spa, leisure activities in the spare time, etc. The time "on the job" for students is School Life, for others working in their profession. Daily Life is basically a synonym for everything normal, repetitive, and trivial happening to your average person.

tag.name: religion
tag.description: Religion is a collection of belief systems, cultural systems, and worldviews that relate humanity to spirituality and, sometimes, to moral values. Many religions have narratives, symbols, traditions and sacred histories that are intended to give meaning to life or to explain the origin of life or the universe. They tend to derive morality, ethics, religious laws or a preferred lifestyle from their ideas about the cosmos and human nature.

tag.name: tragedy
tag.description: Tragedy is a form of drama characterized by seriousness and dignity, usually involving a conflict between a character and some higher power, such as the law, the gods, fate, or society.

tag.name: plot twists
tag.description: The plot and story of this anime may seem to be going along a quite predictable path, when suddenly there is a jarring unexpected twist in the plot, taking the viewer by surprise.

tag.name: dear mother in heaven
tag.description: A form of veneration of ancestors, where people call upon their ancestors for help, advice and similar in their everyday life like in other cultures upon God, Jesus, the Virgin Mary or various saints. The veneration of the spirit`s of one`s ancestors is an integral part of Japanese culture.

tag.name: Sekai Meisaku Gekijou
tag.description: World Masterpiece Theatre is a Japanese TV anime staple that showcases an animated version of a different classical book or story each year. It originally aired from 1969 to 1997 and then resumed in 2007. WMT series were originally produced by http://anidb.net/cr833 [Mushi Production] and Zuiyo Eizo, and then by the latter`s successor http://anidb.net/cr728 [Nippon Animation], and originally air primarily on http://anidb.net/cr741 [Fuji Television]. The series has been known by various different names over the years, often reflecting changes to the sponsors, but "World Masterpiece Theatre" is the name most commonly used by viewers. Nippon Animation`s official English name for the series is The Classic Family Theater Series. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: narration
tag.description: The most common example is that of a voice, either that of one of the characters or entirely unrelated, that appears at the beginning of an episode to offer a summary or introduction, and at the end of an episode for closure or for a preview to hint upon what to expect next. Another use of narration comes in the form of a dominant voice belonging to one of the protagonists, intended only for the viewer and revealing the intimate thoughts to whom it belongs. This type of narration occurs frequently throughout the duration of the episode or movie.

tag.name: poverty
tag.description: It refers to the condition of not having the means to afford basic human needs.

tag.name: female protagonist
tag.description: The anime has a female protagonist.

tag.name: technical aspects
tag.description: It may sometimes be useful to know about technical aspects of a show, such as information about its broadcasting or censorship. Such information can be found here.

tag.name: multi-anime projects
tag.description: Many anime are created as part of larger projects encompassing many shows without direct relation to one another. Normally, there is a specific idea in mind: for example, the http://anidb.net/t4859 [Young Animator Training Project] aims to stimulate the on-the-job training of next-generation professionals of the anime industry, whereas the http://anidb.net/t3763 [World Masterpiece Theatre] aims to animate classical stories from all over the world.

tag.name: tropes
tag.description: A trope is a commonly recurring literary and rhetorical devices, motifs or clichés in creative works. This use is a broader redefining of a literary trope, the use of figurative language, via word, phrase, or even an image, for artistic effect, such as using a figure of speech. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Pollyanna Whittier
character.description: The daughter of Jennie (1883 - 1916) and John Whittier. Pollyanna is the main focus of the story. After becoming an orphan at a young age, she is to move in with her maternal aunt, Polly, who seems to only think about punishing her for she is not the young lady worth of the Harrington family that she expects her to be. Instead she is a cheerful, happy, energetic young girl who is always seeing the good in things and people. Whomever Pollyanna meets is touched by the way she sees the world, and changes. Pollyanna is leaving a handprint on people`s hearts. Her best friend is a chipmunk.

character.name: Chipmunk
character.description: Pollyanna`s pet and friend. They are practically inseparable.

character.name: John Whittier
character.description: John Whittier is a widower raising his only daughter Pollyanna after the death of his wife Jennie. To the community he is known as Pastor John, and not in the best of health.

character.name: Hephzibah White
character.description: A lady from the community, and wife to Jeremiah White. She cares for Pollyanna in a very strict way. She wants her to become a proper lady by trying to teach her in sewing, cooking and cleaning, because she gave a promise to Pollyanna`s deceased mother Jennie.

character.name: Karen
character.description: A friend of Pollyanna`s from the west.

character.name: Jeremiah O White
character.description: Unlike his wife, he likes to spoil Pollyanna. He thinks that she is just a child and doesn`t need to be instructed in how to be a proper lady at that age.

character.name: Grey-fujin
character.description: Part of the townsfolk.

character.name: Hariman-fujin
character.description: Part of the townsfolk.

character.name: Carr-bokushi
character.description: The pastor who came after John Whittier passed away, to fulfill the pastor`s will.

character.name: Nancy Hartley
character.description: Nancy is the maid in the Harrington household.

character.name: Polly Harrington
character.description: She`s the younger sister of Pollyanna`s deceased mother, thus Pollyanna`s aunt. The late John Whittier has set in motion, that Pollyanna shall live with her after his death, if possible. Polly never forgave John for taking her beloved sister Jennie away with him. After her parents died, she turned into a bitter woman that is focused on keeping up an appearance as well as the family`s reputation. She`s not very fond of Pollyanna at first, yet will find that nothing better could have happened to her than taking in this little girl.

character.name: Tom Peyson
character.description: Tom works on the Harrington family estate as a gardener. He`s also the father of Timothy, and husband to Durgin. It is mentioned a few times that he works there for a long time already and knew Polly and Jennie when they were kids.

character.name: Timothy Peyson
character.description: Timothy is Tom`s son. He works for Polly.

character.name: Lewis-fujin
character.description: Part of the Woman`s Aid. She`s one of the women willing to take in Pollyanna after her father`s fall.

character.name: Youfukuten-shujin
character.description: The owner of the clothing store aunt Polly takes Pollyanna to buy clothes in.

character.name: Youfukuten-ten`in
character.description: The employee at the clothing store aunt Polly takes Pollyanna to buy clothes in.

character.name: Durgin Peyson
character.description: Wife to Tom, and mother to Timothy.

character.name: Frank-sensei
character.description: Pollyanna`s piano teacher.

character.name: Jimmy Bean
character.description: Pollyanna meets Jimmy first while playing around on the railing of a bridge. Upon falling down, he saves her from falling into the water. Jimmy himself is an orphan that was sent from another orphanage to Beldingsville. But the orphanage there also can`t take him in so he becomes homeless and starts to do some work for Tom. Instead of money he gets materials to build his own home in the Pendleton woods. One day, upon finishing his little shack, Pollyanna learns from him that his dead father left an envelope with information about him with the orphanage staff before he died. On it are instructions for it not to be opened until the boy turns 30 years old. Pollyanna is focused on finding out what is in the letter, hoping it would be Jimmy`s pedigree - all in order to get Mr Pendleton to adopt him.

character.name: John Pendleton
character.description: He appears at first as a gumpy man who never greets anybody, which is something Pollyanna has to inquire about. Of course he`s not a grumpy old man at all, but somebody whose heart has been broken in the past. He went on travels to China and India to forget about everything, but returned to his family estate. With Pollyanna`s cheerful manner to always look for something to be happy about, she also manages to change John`s heart to the better.

character.name: Mise no Shujin
character.description: The owner of the shop Jimmy Bean gets thrown out of.

character.name: Otoko
character.description: A man that screams at Jimmy Bean, thinking he is about to do something bad because he is sneaking around.

character.name: Snow-fujin
character.description: A bedridden woman that is being taken care of by the local church women. Pollyanna heard one day from Nancy that she is going to visit her once a week and insisted on visiting her as well. Miss Snow is described as an eccentric women. Nancy told Pollyanna that when she brings her calf soup, she`d complain that she`d rather have chicken soup instead.

character.name: Milly Snow
character.description: Milly Snow lives with her bedridden mother.

character.name: Bokushi-fujin
character.description: The leader of the woman`s aid in Beldingsville.

character.name: Ezra
character.description: Ezra works in John Pendleton`s household. She says she`s not hard of hearing, yet always goes `EEEEH?` when Pollyanna says something.

character.name: Thomas Chilton
character.description: Doctor Thomas Chilton is John Pendleton`s doctor. When John fell and broke a leg, Pollyanna rushes to his house and calls him for help. Pollyanna is baffled at his voice, because it sounds so much like her late father`s. Chilton is one of the two doctors in Beldingsville, and the answer to a question asked...

character.name: Polly
character.description: A young Polly Harrington.

character.name: Haha
character.description: Polly`s and Jennie`s mother.

character.name: Jennie Harrington
character.description: A young woman who was later to become John Whittier`s wife, and Pollyanna`s mother.

character.name: Harold
character.description: Harold is Doctor Chilton`s assistant.

character.name: Benton-fujin
character.description: A woman from Beldingsville. Pollyanna meets her when visiting Chilton`s clinic for the first time.

character.name: Otoko
character.description: The very reckless driver of a car. He runs over Pollyanna.

character.name: Warren-sensei
character.description: Doctor Warren is the Harrington family`s doctor.

character.name: Mead-sensei
character.description: Doctor Mead is a medical specialist from New York. Polly calls on him after Pollyanna is run over by a car. Pollyanna instantly likes him.

character.name: Jennie Whittier
character.description: Jennie at the time she was going to go live with John.

character.name: Polly Harrington
character.description: Polly was very angry when Jennie decided to leave with John. Blaming him since then to be responsible for taking away her older sister.

character.name: Charlie Ames
character.description: When Pollyanna is stuck in the wheelchair, doctor Chilton sends her to his friend, specialist doctor Charlie Ames. He is supposed to help Pollyanna with her future.

character.name: Della Wetherby
character.description: Della is Doctor Ames` assistent, a nurse. She works like him in Boston.

character.name: Perkins
character.description: Perkins is employed by Della`s sister as the family`s driver.

character.name: Mary
character.description: Mary is a maid employed by Della`s sister.

character.name: Ruth Carew
character.description: Ruth is Della`s older sister. She`s a wealthy lady with a big house including staff. After becoming depressed, Della became really worried about her and asked Polly to "borrow" Pollyanna to live with her in Boston - where Pollyanna also gets her treatment -, to help her sister become happy again. For six years Ruth has been shutting herself into her own home, with the curtains closed and no contact to the outside world. She once had a husband, and even a child - both are dead. The event that made her as depressed and unhappy as she is when Pollyanna meets her wasn`t the death of her own family though, it was the death of her sister and the disappearance of her dear nephew Jamie due to his father Edward. Since then she has tried finding him through other people, yet without any success. Pollyanna gets involved and tries to find the boy whatever it takes.

character.name: Sadie Dean
character.description: Pollyanna and Sadie meet for the first time when Pollyanna is sneaking out of the Carew house to look for Chipmunk. Sadie accuses her of being a thief, because of her looks. She lives next door to the Carew house.

character.name: Beth
character.description: Beth is Sadie`s servant.

character.name: Mickey Murphy
character.description: Mickey is a newspaper boy from Boston. He meets Pollyanna for the first time when she is lost after trying to find Chipmunk.

character.name: Bridget
character.description: Bridget is the cook at the Carew house.

character.name: Jaime
character.description: Jaime is a wheelchair-bound boy. Pollyanna meets him on her quest to find Chipmunk. He has been in "posession" of him the whole time, calling him Sir Lancelor.

character.name: Susy
character.description: Susy is a maid in the Carew household.

character.name: Bokushi
character.description: The pastor at the church in Boston.

character.name: Doris Kent
character.description: Doris was Ruth`s and Della`s older sister. One day she suddenly died from an illness, leaving behind her 4-year-old son Jamie, and a husband.

character.name: Jamie Kent
character.description: Jamie suddenly lost his mother to an illness when he was 4 years old. He is Ruth`s and Della`s nephew, the child of their late older sister Doris. Jamie was supposed to inherit all the wealth and businesses of both the Wetherby and Carew families. Edward Kent, Jamie`s father, took his son one day and left - nowhere to be found.

character.name: Betty Murphy
character.description: Betty is Mickey`s mother, and Jamie`s foster mother. After Jamie`s father died, she took him in to raise him like her own son.

character.name: Edward Kent
character.description: Edward was Doris` husband, and Jamie`s father. He took Jamie after Doris` sudden death away from the wealth, in order to raise him poor, so he can become strong.

character.name: Willis
character.description: One of Thomas Chilton`s patients. He calls him out during the beginning of a heavy storm.

character.name: Harry
character.description: Supposedly a private investigator hired by Ruth Carew to find her real nephew Jamie.

episode.title: 丘の上の讃美歌
The Hymn on Top of the Hill
Abschied von den Bergen
Une triste journée
Oka no Ue no Sanbika
どうして幸福になれないの?
Why Can`t I Be Happy?
Tante Carew ist traurig
À la recherche du bonheur
Doushite Shiawase ni Narenai no?
危ない! ポリアンナ
Watch Out, Pollyanna!
Ein böses Erwachen
L`accident

さよなら! ベルディングスビル
Goodbye, Beldingsville!
Pollyanna zieht um
Le départ
Sayonara! Beldingsville
たのしいボストン見物
The Fun of Sightseeing around Boston
Abschied von Boston
Le retour
Tanoshii Boston Kenbutsu
カリウ夫人の悲しい秘密
Mrs. Carew`s Sad Secret
Ein trauriges Geheimnis
Le secret de Mme Carew
Carew-fujin no Kanashii Himitsu
よかったが探せない!
I Can`t Find Something To Be Glad About!
Unerwarteter Besuch
La fillette la plus aimée
Yokatta ga Sagasenai!
さよならパーティ事件
The Trouble at The Farewell Party
Die Abschiedsfeier
Une fête d`adieu
Sayonara Party Jiken
怒らないで! おば様
Don`t Be Angry, Aunt Polly
Die kleine Friseuse
Désaccord
Okoranaide! Oba-sama
大都会ボストンの生活
Life in the Big City of Boston
Ankunft in Boston
La maison de Boston
Daitokai Boston no Seikatsu
死なないでチルトン先生!
Don`t Die, Dr. Chilton!
Abschied von Dr. Chilton
Adieu docteur Chilton
Shinanaide Chilton-sensei
死なないでポリアンナ
Don`t Die, Pollyanna!
Die Operation
Ne me quitte pas
Shinanaide Pollyanna
不思議な特効薬?
The Mysterious Tonic?
Krankenbesuch bei John
Une Harrington dans la maison des Pendelton
Fushigi na Tokkouyaku?
チップマックがいない!
Chipmunk Has Gone Missing!
Eichhörnchen ist weg
La ville de glace
Chipmunk ga Inai!
ジェミー・ケントの謎
The Mystery of Jaime Kent
Das Geheimnis von Jamie Kent
Le mystère de Jamie Kent
Jamie Kent no Nazo
本当のジェミーが欲しい!!
I Want the Real Jamie!
Wo ist der richtige Jamie?
Un autre Jamie
Hontou no Jamie ga Hoshii!!
幸福はすぐそばに
Happiness Nearby
Ein glückliches Ende
Tout va pour le mieux dans le meilleur des mondes possibles
Shiawase wa Sugu Soba ni
